metadata.Title: CVE-2023-20592 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper or unexpected behavior of the INVD instruction in some AMD CPUs may allow an attacker with a malicious hypervisor to affect cache line write-back behavior of the CPU leading to a potential loss of guest virtual machine (VM) memory integrity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

amd64-microcode - 3.20191021.1+really3.20181128.1~ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Ruiyi Zhang, Lukas Gerlach, Daniel Weber, Lorenz Hetterich, Youheng Lue, Leon Trampert, Andreas Kogler and Michael Schwarz

notes.Note: alexmurray> The microcode revisions listed in the AMD advisory AMD-SB-3005 were contained in the upstream commit b250b32ab1d044953af2dc5e790819a7703b7ee6 - this was already provided to the various Ubuntu releases in USN-6319-1 for CVE-2023-20569, as such they are not affected by this CVE.

criterions.comment: amd64-microcode package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.20191021.1+really3.20181128.1~ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm2').
